results.title: The Teaching Ambassadors: International Teaching Fellowships
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Looks at the International Fellowship Scheme which operates in Victoria. Highlights the professional development aspects of the project, the influence visiting participants have on school communities and the input gained by schools upon the return of Victorian recipients. Featured speakers include: Rex Murfett, Susan Gianevsky, Richard Wood, Alex McKnight and Kevin Collins.

results.title: Westgarthtown: the German settlement at Thomastown
results.creator_credit: Stuart Miller and Multicultural Materials Production Project
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the first German settlers to the Port Phillip District in 1850 who settled mainly at Westgarthtown which became Thomastown. These first settlers did not speak any English and brought the Lutheran religion to Australia. This German community worked hard to retain the values, beliefs and cultural background of Germany.

results.title: Women working in the media
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.

results.title: Waltzing Matilda: touring Australia
results.brief_description: A tourist promotion that intermingles aspects of Australian history and culture with holiday promotion. Narrated by Charles Tingwell with original music by Bruce Smeaton. The song “Walzing Matilda” played by the Bushwackers Band is used as a theme.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: The Work prejudice film
results.creator_credit: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films
results.brief_description: Investigates the stereotypes surrounding the world of work relevant to an American situation. Documentation and humour are used to motivate the young person who faces 25 to 45 years in the workforce. Narrated by Robert Vaughn. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray Rivas, Allan Frank Sandler and Sandler Institutional Films

results.title: You Can Do It Too!
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A character called “x”, who is neither male nor female, points out all the opportunities available to people when gender is made irrelevant. Shows how role stereotyping begins at birth and carries through into school and work. Shows men and women working and finding fulfilment in non-traditional areas. The band playing towards the end of the film features the now ABC political journalist, Fran Kelly, in an unfamiliar guise.

results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: [Churchill Island]
results.brief_description: No title or credits available. An overview of the history of Churchill Island which was purchased by the Victoria Conservation Trust in January 1976 to be kept for the people of Victoria. It is a small island in size, yet large in both historical and conservation significance. Situated in Westernport Bay near Phillip Island, Churchill Island was first discovered on 5th January, 1798 by George Bass. A detailed booklet accompanies this film.
